2. Reference Implementation
  3. 1. Basic do Notation
  4. 2. Local Mutation
    1. 2.1. Nondeterminism Monad
  6. 3. Early Return
  7. 4. Iteration
  9. Formalization
  10. 5. Formalization

"'do' Unchained" rendered supplement

Basic do notation

open Lean

declare_syntax_cat stmt
syntax "do'" stmt : term

-- Prevent `if ...` from being parsed as a term
syntax (priority := low) term : stmt
syntax "let" ident "‚Üê" stmt:1 ";" stmt : stmt
macro "{" 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s:stmt "}" : stmt => `($
s: TSyntax `stmt
s)

/-
  Remark: we annotate `macro`s and `macro_rules` with their corresponding
  translation/abbreviation id from the paper.
-/

syntax "d!" stmt : term  -- corresponds to `D(s)`

macro_rules
  | `(do' $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s) => `(d! $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s)  -- (1)

-- helper function; see usage below
def 
expandStmt: TSyntax `stmt ‚Üí MacroM (TSyntax `stmt)
expandStmt (
s: TSyntax `stmt
s : 
TSyntax: SyntaxNodeKinds ‚Üí Type
TSyntax 
`stmt: Name
`stmt) : 
MacroM: Type ‚Üí Type
MacroM (
TSyntax: SyntaxNodeKinds ‚Üí Type
TSyntax 
`stmt: Name
`stmt) := do
  let 
s': Syntax
s' ‚Üê 
expandMacros: Syntax ‚Üí (optParam (SyntaxNodeKind ‚Üí Bool) fun k => k != `Lean.Parser.Term.byTactic) ‚Üí MacroM Syntax
expandMacros 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s
  if 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s == 
s': Syntax
s' then
    
Macro.throwUnsupported: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí MacroM Œ±
Macro.throwUnsupported
  else
    -- There is no static guarantee that `expandMacros` stays in the `stmt` category,
    -- but it is true for all our macros
    return 
TSyntax.mk: {ks : SyntaxNodeKinds} ‚Üí Syntax ‚Üí TSyntax ks
TSyntax.mk 
s': Syntax
s'

macro_rules
  | `(d! $
e: TSyntax `term
e:term) => `($
e: TSyntax `term
e)                                       -- (D1)
  | `(d! let $
x: TSyntax `ident
x ‚Üê $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s') => `((d! $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s) >>= fun $
x: TSyntax `ident
x => (d! $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s'))  -- (D2)
  | `(d! $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s) => do
    -- fallback rule: try to expand abbreviation
    let 
s': TSyntax `stmt
s' ‚Üê 
expandStmt: TSyntax `stmt ‚Üí MacroM (TSyntax `stmt)
expandStmt 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s
    `(d! $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s')

macro "let" 
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident ":=" 
e: TSyntax `term
e:term ";" 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s:stmt : stmt => `(let $
x: TSyntax `ident
x ‚Üê pure $
e: TSyntax `term
e; $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s)  -- (A1)
-- priority `0` prevents `;` from being used in trailing contexts without braces (see e.g. `:1` above)
macro:0 
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ:stmt ";" 
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ:stmt : stmt => `(let x ‚Üê $
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ; $
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ)                     -- (A2)
import Do.Basic
import Do.LazyList

Local Mutation

open Lean

Disable the automatic monadic lifting feature described in the paper. We want to make it clear that we do not depend on it.

set_option autoLift false

syntax "let" "mut" ident ":=" term ";" stmt : stmt
syntax ident ":=" term : stmt
syntax "if" term "then" stmt "else" stmt:1 : stmt

declare_syntax_cat expander
-- generic syntax for traversal-like functions S_y/R/B/L
syntax "expand!" expander "in" stmt:1 : stmt
syntax "mut" ident : expander  -- corresponds to `S_y`

-- generic traversal rules
macro_rules
  | `(stmt| expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in let $
x: TSyntax `ident
x ‚Üê $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s') => `(stmt| let $
x: TSyntax `ident
x ‚Üê expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s')                -- subsumes (R3, B4, L4)
  | `(stmt| expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in let mut $
x: TSyntax `ident
x := $
e: TSyntax `term
e; $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s') => `(stmt| let mut $
x: TSyntax `ident
x := $
e: TSyntax `term
e; expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s')                      -- subsumes (R4, B5, L5)
  | `(stmt| expand! $_ in $
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident := $
e: TSyntax `term
e) => `(stmt| $
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident := $
e: TSyntax `term
e)                                                      -- subsumes (R5, B6, L6)
  | `(stmt| expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in if $
e: TSyntax `term
e then $
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ else $
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ) => `(stmt| if $
e: TSyntax `term
e then expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in $
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ else expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in $
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ)  -- subsumes (S6, R6, B7, L7)
  | `(stmt| expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s) => do
    let 
s': TSyntax `stmt
s' ‚Üê 
expandStmt: TSyntax `stmt ‚Üí MacroM (TSyntax `stmt)
expandStmt 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s
    `(stmt| expand! $
exp: TSyntax `expander
exp in $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s')


macro_rules
  | `(d! let mut $
x: TSyntax `ident
x := $
e: TSyntax `term
e; $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s) => `(let $
x: TSyntax `ident
x := $
e: TSyntax `term
e; StateT.run' (d! expand! mut $
x: TSyntax `ident
x in $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s) $
x: TSyntax `ident
x) -- (D3)
  | `(d! $
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident := $_:term) =>
      -- `s!"..."` is an interpolated string. For more information, see https://leanprover.github.io/lean4/doc/stringinterp.html.
      
throw: {Œµ : Type} ‚Üí {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí [self : MonadExcept Œµ m] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œµ ‚Üí m Œ±
throw <| 
Macro.Exception.error: Syntax ‚Üí String ‚Üí Macro.Exception
Macro.Exception.error 
x: TSyntax `ident
x s!"variable '{
x: TSyntax `ident
x.
getId: Ident ‚Üí Name
getId}' is not reassignable in this scope"
  | `(d! if $
e: TSyntax `term
e then $
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ else $
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ) => `(if $
e: TSyntax `term
e then d! $
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ else d! $
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ)                       -- (D4)

macro_rules
  | `(stmt| expand! mut $_ in $
e: TSyntax `term
e:term) => `(stmt| StateT.lift $
e: TSyntax `term
e)  -- (S1)
  | `(stmt| expand! mut $
y: TSyntax `ident
y in let $
x: TSyntax `ident
x ‚Üê $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s') =>                -- (S2)
    if 
x: TSyntax `ident
x == 
y: TSyntax `ident
y then
      
throw: {Œµ : Type} ‚Üí {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí [self : MonadExcept Œµ m] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œµ ‚Üí m Œ±
throw <| 
Macro.Exception.error: Syntax ‚Üí String ‚Üí Macro.Exception
Macro.Exception.error 
x: TSyntax `ident
x s!"cannot shadow 'mut' variable '{
x: TSyntax `ident
x.
getId: Ident ‚Üí Name
getId}'"
    else
      `(stmt| let $
x: TSyntax `ident
x ‚Üê expand! mut $
y: TSyntax `ident
y in $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; let $
y: TSyntax `ident
y ‚Üê get; expand! mut $
y: TSyntax `ident
y in $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s')
  | `(stmt| expand! mut $
y: TSyntax `ident
y in let mut $
x: TSyntax `ident
x := $
e: TSyntax `term
e; $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s') =>           -- (S3)
    if 
x: TSyntax `ident
x == 
y: TSyntax `ident
y then
      
throw: {Œµ : Type} ‚Üí {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí [self : MonadExcept Œµ m] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œµ ‚Üí m Œ±
throw <| 
Macro.Exception.error: Syntax ‚Üí String ‚Üí Macro.Exception
Macro.Exception.error 
x: TSyntax `ident
x s!"cannot shadow 'mut' variable '{
x: TSyntax `ident
x.
getId: Ident ‚Üí Name
getId}'"
    else
      `(stmt| let mut $
x: TSyntax `ident
x := $
e: TSyntax `term
e; expand! mut $
y: TSyntax `ident
y in $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s')
  | `(stmt| expand! mut $
y: TSyntax `ident
y in $
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident := $
e: TSyntax `term
e) =>
    if 
x: TSyntax `ident
x == 
y: TSyntax `ident
y then
      `(stmt| set $
e: TSyntax `term
e)                                             -- (S5)
    else
      `(stmt| $
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident := $
e: TSyntax `term
e)                                     -- (S4)

macro:0 "let" "mut" 
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident "‚Üê" 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s:stmt:1 ";" 
s': TSyntax `stmt
s':stmt : stmt => `(let y ‚Üê $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; let mut $
x: TSyntax `ident
x := y; $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s') -- (A3)
macro:0 
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident "‚Üê" 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s:stmt:1 : stmt => `(let y ‚Üê $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; $
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident := y)                                -- (A4)
-- a variant of (A4) since we technically cannot make the above macro a `stmt`
macro:0 
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident "‚Üê" 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s:stmt:1 ";" 
s': TSyntax `stmt
s':stmt : stmt => `(let y ‚Üê $
s: TSyntax `stmt
s; $
x: TSyntax `ident
x:ident := y; $
s': TSyntax `stmt
s')
macro "if" 
e: TSyntax `term
e:term "then" 
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ:stmt:1 : stmt => `(if $
e: TSyntax `term
e then $
s‚ÇÅ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÅ else pure ())                        -- (A5)
macro "unless" 
e: TSyntax `term
e:term "do'" 
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ:stmt:1 : stmt => `(if $
e: TSyntax `term
e then pure () else $
s‚ÇÇ: TSyntax `stmt
s‚ÇÇ)                     -- (A6)

/-
The `variable` command instructs Lean to insert the declared variables as bound variables
in definitions that refer to them.
-/

variable [
Monad: (Type ‚Üí Type u_1) ‚Üí Type (max 1 u_1)
Monad 
m: Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2
m]
variable (
ma: m Œ±
ma 
ma': m Œ±
ma' : 
m: Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2
m 
Œ±: Type ?u.10009
Œ±)

/-
  Mark `map_eq_pure_bind` as a simplification lemma.
  It is a theorem for
  `f <$> x = x >>= pure (f a)`
-/
attribute [local simp] 
map_eq_pure_bind: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œ± Œ≤ : Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤) (x : m Œ±),
  f <$> x = do
    let a ‚Üê x
    pure (f a)
map_eq_pure_bind

/-
  Remark: an `example` in Lean is like a "nameless" definition, and it does not update the environment.
  It is useful for writing tests.
-/

/-
  The instance `[LawfulMonad m]` contains the monadic laws.
  For more information, see https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/blob/v4.0.0-m4/src/Init/Control/Lawful.lean
-/


example: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] (ma : m Œ±) [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m],
  (do
      let y ‚Üê ma
      let x : Œ± := y
      StateT.run' (StateT.lift (pure x)) x) =
    ma
example [
LawfulMonad: (m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2) ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Prop
LawfulMonad 
m: Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2
m] :
    (do' let mut 
x: Œ±
x ‚Üê 
ma: m Œ±
ma;
         
pure: {f : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} ‚Üí [self : Pure f] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí f Œ±
pure 
x: Œ±
x : 
m: Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2
m 
Œ±: Type u_1
Œ±)
    =
    
ma: m Œ±
ma
:= 
m: Type ?u.10102 ‚Üí Type ?u.10058

  ma

example: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] (ma ma' : m Œ±) [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m],
  (do
      let y ‚Üê ma
      let x : Œ± := y
      StateT.run'
          (do
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift ma'
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
            let x ‚Üê get
            StateT.lift (pure x))
          x) =
    do
    let _ ‚Üê ma
    ma'

/- The command `#check_failure <term>` succeeds only if `<term>` fails to be elaborated. -/


do
  let y ‚Üê ma
  let x : Œ± := y
  sorryAx (m ?m.13198) true : m ?m.13198
 
do
  let y ‚Üê ma
  let x : Œ± := y
  sorryAx (m ?m.13198) true : m ?m.13198
Warning: cannot shadow 'mut' variable 'x'
 
do
  let y ‚Üê ma
  let x : Œ± := y
  sorryAx (m ?m.13198) true : m ?m.13198



do
  let _ ‚Üê ma
  sorryAx (m ?m.13260) true : m ?m.13260

  
do
  let _ ‚Üê ma
  sorryAx (m ?m.13260) true : m ?m.13260
Warning: variable 'x' is not reassignable in this scope
 
do
  let _ ‚Üê ma
  sorryAx (m ?m.13260) true : m ?m.13260


variable (
b: Bool
b : 
Bool: Type
Bool)

-- The following equivalence is true even if `m` does not satisfy the monadic laws.

example: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {Œ± : Type} [inst : Monad m] (ma : m Œ±) (b : Bool),
  (if b = true then discard ma else pure ()) = if b = true then discard ma else pure ()
example :
    (do' if 
b: Bool
b then {
           
discard: {f : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Functor f] ‚Üí f Œ± ‚Üí f PUnit
discard 
ma: m Œ±
ma
         })
    =
    (if 
b: Bool
b then 
discard: {f : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Functor f] ‚Üí f Œ± ‚Üí f PUnit
discard 
ma: m Œ±
ma else 
pure: {f : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [self : Pure f] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí f Œ±
pure ())
:= 
rfl: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {a : Œ±}, a = a
rfl

theorem 
simple: ‚àÄ [inst : LawfulMonad m],
  (do
      let y ‚Üê ma
      let x : Œ± := y
      StateT.run'
          (do
            if b = true then do
                let y ‚Üê StateT.lift ma'
                let _ ‚Üê get
                set y
              else StateT.lift (pure ())
            let x ‚Üê get
            StateT.lift (pure x))
          x) =
    do
    let x ‚Üê ma
    if b = true then ma' else pure x
simple [
LawfulMonad: (m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1) ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Prop
LawfulMonad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m] :
    (do' let mut 
x: Œ±
x ‚Üê 
ma: m Œ±
ma;
         if 
b: Bool
b then {
           x ‚Üê 
ma': m Œ±
ma'
         };

x)

    (
ma: m Œ±
ma >>= fun 
x: Œ±

b: Bool
b then 
ma': m Œ±
ma' else

x: Œ±
x)

b: Bool
(do
    let y ‚Üê ma
    let x : Œ± := y

        (do
          if b = true then do
              let y ‚Üê StateT.lift ma'
              let _ ‚Üê get

          let x ‚Üê get

Goals accomplished! üêô



example: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] (ma ma' : m Œ±) (b : Bool) [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m]
  (f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ±),
  (do
      let y ‚Üê ma
      let x : Œ± := y
      StateT.run'
          (do
            let y ‚Üê
              if b = true then do
                  let y ‚Üê StateT.lift ma
                  let _ ‚Üê get
                  set y
                  let _ ‚Üê get
                  StateT.lift ma'
                else StateT.lift ma'
            let x ‚Üê get
            StateT.lift (pure (f x y)))
          x) =
    do
    let x ‚Üê ma
    if b = true then do
        let x ‚Üê ma
        let y ‚Üê ma'
        pure (f x y)
      else do
        let y ‚Üê ma'
        pure (f x y)

import Do.Mut

Early Return

open Lean

/- Disable the automatic monadic lifting feature described in the paper.
   We want to make it clear that we do not depend on it. -/
set_option autoLift false

def

example: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] (ma : m Œ±) [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m],

    (ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
      let x ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (pure 1)

rfl: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type} {a : Œ±}, a = a

example: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {Œ± : Type} [inst : Monad m] (ma ma' : m Œ±) (b : Bool) [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m],

      if b = true then do
          let x ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift ma
          throw x
        else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
      ExceptCpsT.lift ma') =
    if b = true then ma else ma'
example [
LawfulMonad: (m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1) ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Prop
LawfulMonad

import Do.Return

Iteration

open Lean

/- Disable the automatic monadic lifting feature described in the paper.
   We want to make it clear that we do not depend on it. -/
set_option autoLift false

syntax "for" ident "in" term "do'" stmt:1 : stmt
syntax "break " : stmt
syntax "continue " : stmt

syntax "break" : expander
syntax "continue" : expander
syntax "lift" : expander

attribute [local simp]

example: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {Œ± : Type} [inst : Monad m] (xs : List Œ±) {Œ≤ : Type} {init : Œ≤} [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m]
  (f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤), ex2 f init xs = List.foldlM f init xs

Œ±: Type

ma, ma': m Œ±

Œ≤: Type

ex2 f init xs = List.foldlM f init xs

  
m: Type ‚Üí Type ?u.8948
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
ma, ma': m Œ±
b: Bool
xs: List Œ±
act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
Œ≤: Type
init: Œ≤
f: Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
ExceptCpsT.runCatch
    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        forM xs fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
        let y ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw y))
      y) =
  List.foldlM f init xs
;

ExceptCpsT.runCatch
    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        forM [] fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
        let y ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw y))
      y) =
  List.foldlM f init []
m: Type ‚Üí Type ?u.8948
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m

act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit

f: Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤

ExceptCpsT.runCatch
    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        forM (head‚úù :: tail‚úù) fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
        let y ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw y))
      y) =
  List.foldlM f init (head‚úù :: tail‚úù)

    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        forM [] fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
        let y ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw y))
      y) =
  List.foldlM f init []
m: Type ‚Üí Type ?u.8948
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
ma, ma': m Œ±
b: Bool
xs: List Œ±
act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
Œ≤: Type
f: Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
head‚úù: Œ±
tail‚úù: List Œ±
init: Œ≤
ExceptCpsT.runCatch
    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        forM (head‚úù :: tail‚úù) fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
        let y ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw y))
      y) =
  List.foldlM f init (head‚úù :: tail‚úù)
 
Goals accomplished! üêô


@[simp] theorem

theorem 
byCases_Bool_bind: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] {Œ≤ : Type} (x : m Bool) (f g : Bool ‚Üí m Œ≤),
  f true = g true ‚Üí f false = g false ‚Üí x >>= f = x >>= g

x: m Bool

cons
(ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM (x :: xs) fun x => do
        let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
        if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)) =
  do
  let a ‚Üê p x
  match a with
    | true => pure (some x)
    | false => List.findM? p xs

Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
ma, ma': m Œ±

act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit

xs: List Œ±
ih: (ExceptCpsT.runCatch do

        if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)) =

        if a = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())

            let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
            if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())

def 
ex3: [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3 [
Monad: (Type ‚Üí Type u_1) ‚Üí Type (max 1 u_1)
Monad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m] (
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p : 
Œ±: Type
Œ± ‚Üí

m 
Bool: Type
Bool) (
xss: List (List Œ±)

List (

List 
Œ±: Type
Œ±)) : 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m (
Option: Type ‚Üí Type
Option 
Œ±: Type
Œ±) := do'
  for 
xs: List Œ±
xs in 
xss: List (List Œ±)
xss do' {
    for 
x: Œ±
x in 
xs: List Œ±
xs do' {
      let 
b: Bool
b ‚Üê 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p 
x: Œ±
x;
      if 
b: Bool
b then {
        return 
some: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Option Œ±
some 
x: Œ±
x
      }
    }
  };
  
pure: {f : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [self : Pure f] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí f Œ±
pure 
none: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Option Œ±
none

theorem 
eq_findSomeM_findM: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {Œ± : Type} [inst : Monad m] (p : Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (xss : List (List Œ±)),
  ex3 p xss = List.findSomeM? (fun xs => List.findM? p xs) xss
eq_findSomeM_findM [
LawfulMonad: (m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1) ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Prop
LawfulMonad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m] (
xss: List (List Œ±)
xss : 
List: Type ‚Üí Type
List (
List: Type ‚Üí Type
List 
Œ±: Type
Œ±)) :
    
ex3: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p 
xss: List (List Œ±)
xss = 
xss: List (List Œ±)
xss.
findSomeM?: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí {Œ± Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m (Option Œ≤)) ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m (Option Œ≤)

xs: List Œ±
xs => 
xs: List Œ±
xs.

Œ±: Type

p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
ex3 p xss = List.findSomeM? (fun xs => List.findM? p xs) xss

  
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
ma, ma': m Œ±
b: Bool
xs: List Œ±
act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
(ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM xss fun xs =>
        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)) =
  List.findSomeM? (fun xs => List.findM? p xs) xss

m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
ma, ma': m Œ±

xs‚úù: List Œ±
act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
x: Œ±
xs: List Œ±
ih: (ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM xs fun x => do
        let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
        if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    forM xss fun xs =>
        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)) =
  do
  let a ‚Üê
    ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
        forM xs fun x => do
            let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
            if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
        ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)

    | some b => pure (some b)
    | none =>

              let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
              if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())

def 
List.untilM: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
List.untilM (
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p : 
Œ±: Type
Œ± ‚Üí 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m 
Bool: Type
Bool) : 
List: Type ‚Üí Type
List 
Œ±: Type
Œ± ‚Üí 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m 
Unit: Type
Unit
  | []    => 
pure: {f : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [self : Pure f] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí f Œ±
pure 
(): Unit
()
  | 
a: Œ±
a::
as: List Œ±
as => 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p 
a: Œ±
a >>= fun | 
true: Bool
true => 
pure: {f : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [self : Pure f] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí f Œ±
pure 
(): Unit
() | 
false: Bool
false => 
as: List Œ±
as.
untilM: (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
untilM 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p

theorem 
eq_untilM: ‚àÄ [inst : LawfulMonad m],
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch
      (forM xs fun x => do
        let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
        if b = true then throw () else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())) =
    List.untilM p xs
eq_untilM [
LawfulMonad: (m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1) ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Prop
LawfulMonad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m] :
  (do' for 
x: Œ±
x in 
xs: List Œ±
xs do' {
         let 
b: Bool
b ‚Üê 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p 
x: Œ±
x;
         if 
b: Bool
b then {
           break
         }
       })
  =
  
xs: List Œ±
xs.
untilM: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
untilM 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p
:=

Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
ma, ma': m Œ±
b: Bool
xs: List Œ±
act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool

    (forM xs fun x => do
      let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
      if b = true then throw () else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())) =
  List.untilM p xs

      let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)

  List.untilM p (x :: xs)

            if b = true then throw () else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())) =

    | true => pure ()

m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
ma, ma': m Œ±
b: Bool
xs‚úù: List Œ±
act: Œ± ‚Üí m Unit
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
x: Œ±
xs: List Œ±
cons
(do
    let a ‚Üê p x
    ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
        if a = true then throw () else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
        forM xs fun x => do
            let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
            if b = true then throw () else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())) =
  do
  let x ‚Üê p x
  match x with
    | true => pure ()
    | false =>
      ExceptCpsT.runCatch
        (forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw () else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ()))

-- set_option trace.compiler.ir.init true
def 
ex1: List Nat ‚Üí Nat ‚Üí Id Nat
ex1 (
xs: List Nat
xs : 
List: Type ‚Üí Type
List 
Nat: Type
Nat) (
z: Nat
z : 
Nat: Type
Nat) : 
Id: Type ‚Üí Type
Id 
Nat: Type
Nat := do'
  let mut 
s1: Nat
s1 := 
0: Nat
0;
  let mut 
s2: Nat
s2 := 
0: Nat
0;
  for 
x: Nat
x in 
xs: List Nat
xs do' {
    if 
x: Nat
x % 
2: Nat
2 == 
0: Nat
0 then {
      continue
    };
    if 
x: Nat
x == 
z: Nat
z then {
      return 
s1: Nat
s1
    };
    s1 := 
s1: Nat
s1 + 
x: Nat
x;
    s2 := 
s2: Nat
s2 + 
s1: Nat
s1
  };
  return (
s1: Nat

s2: Nat
s2)

/-
Adding `repeat` and `while` statements

-- The "partial" keyword allows users to define non-terminating functions in Lean.
-- However, we currently cannot reason about them.
@[specialize] partial def 
loopForever: [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Unit ‚Üí m Unit) ‚Üí m Unit
loopForever [

Unit: Type

m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m 
Unit: Type
Unit) : 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m 
Unit: Type
Unit :=
  
f: Unit ‚Üí m Unit
f 
(): Unit
() *> 
loopForever: [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Unit ‚Üí m Unit) ‚Üí m Unit
loopForever 
f: Unit ‚Üí m Unit
f

-- `Loop'` is a "helper" type. It is similar to `Unit`.
-- Its `ForM` instance produces an "infinite" sequence of units.
inductive 
Loop': Type
Loop' where
  | 
mk: Loop'
mk : 
Loop': Type
Loop'


instance: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí ForM m Loop' Unit
instance :

ForM 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m 
Loop': Type
Loop' 
Unit: Type
Unit where
  forM _ 
f: Unit ‚Üí m PUnit
f := 
loopForever: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Unit ‚Üí m Unit) ‚Üí m Unit
loopForever 
f: Unit ‚Üí m PUnit
f

macro:0 "repeat" 
s: TSyntax `stmt
s:stmt:1 : stmt => `(stmt| for u in Loop'.mk do' $

import Do.For  -- import `runCatch`
import Lean
import Aesop

Formalization of Extended do Translation

This is the supplement file to the paper "‚Äòdo‚Äô Unchained: Embracing Local Imperativity in a Purely Functional Language". It contains an intrinsically typed representation of the paper's syntax of do statements as well of their translation functions and an equivalence proof thereof to a simple denotational semantics.

Contexts

We represent contexts as lists of types and assignments of them as heterogeneous lists over these types. As is common with lists, contexts grow to the left in our presentation. The following encoding of heterogeneous lists avoids the universe bump of the usual inductive definition (https://lists.chalmers.se/pipermail/agda/2010/001826.html).

def 
HList: List (Type u) ‚Üí Type u
HList : 
List: Type (u + 1) ‚Üí Type (u + 1)
List (
Type u: Type (u + 1)
Type u) ‚Üí 
Type u: Type (u + 1)
Type u
  | []      => 
PUnit: Type u
PUnit
  | 
Œ±: Type u
Œ± :: 
Œ±s: List (Type u)
Œ±s => 
Œ±: Type u
Œ± √ó 
HList: List (Type u) ‚Üí Type u
HList 
Œ±s: List (Type u)
Œ±s

@[matchPattern] abbrev 
HList.nil: HList []
HList.nil : 
HList: List (Type u_1) ‚Üí Type u_1
HList 
[]: List (Type u_1)
[] := 
‚ü®‚ü©: PUnit
‚ü®‚ü©
@[matchPattern] abbrev 
HList.cons: {Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ±s : List (Type u_1)} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí HList Œ±s ‚Üí HList (Œ± :: Œ±s)
HList.cons (
a: Œ±
a : 
Œ±: Type u_1
Œ±) (
as: HList Œ±s
as : 
HList: List (Type u_1) ‚Üí Type u_1
HList 
Œ±s: List (Type u_1)
Œ±s) : 
HList: List (Type u_1) ‚Üí Type u_1
HList (
Œ±: Type u_1
Œ± :: 
Œ±s: List (Type u_1)
Œ±s) := (
a: Œ±
a, 
as: HList Œ±s
as)

We overload the common list notations :: and [e, ...] for HList.

infixr:67 " :: " => HList.cons

syntax (name := hlistCons) "[" term,* "]" : term
macro_rules (kind := hlistCons)
  | `([])          => 
`(HList.nil): Lean.MacroM Lean.Syntax
`(HList.nil)
  | `([$
x: Lean.TSyntax `term
x])        => `(HList.cons $
x: Lean.TSyntax `term
x [])
  | `([$
x: Lean.TSyntax `term
x, $
xs: Lean.Syntax.TSepArray `term ","
xs,*]) => `(HList.cons $
x: Lean.TSyntax `term
x [$
xs: Lean.Syntax.TSepArray `term ","
xs,*])

Lean's very general, heterogeneous definition of ++ causes some issues with our overloading above in terms such as a ++ [b], so we restrict it to the List interpretation in the following, which is sufficient for our purposes.

local macro_rules
  | `($
a: Lean.TSyntax `term
a ++ $
b: Lean.TSyntax `term
b) => `(List.append $
a: Lean.TSyntax `term
a $
b: Lean.TSyntax `term
b)

abbrev 
Assg: List (Type u_1) ‚Üí Type u_1
Assg 
Œì: List (Type u_1)
Œì := 
HList: List (Type u_1) ‚Üí Type u_1
HList 
Œì: List (Type u_1)
Œì

Updating a heterogeneous list at a given, guaranteed in-bounds index.

def 
HList.set: {Œ±s : List (Type u)} ‚Üí HList Œ±s ‚Üí (i : Fin (List.length Œ±s)) ‚Üí List.get Œ±s i ‚Üí HList Œ±s

Œ±s: List (Type u)

Fin

Œ±s.

Œ±s: List (Type u)
Œ±s.

  | _ :: _, _ ::

We write ‚àÖ for empty contexts and assignments and Œì ‚ä¢ Œ± for the type of values of type Œ± under the context Œì

  • that is, the function type from an assignment to Œ±.
instance: EmptyCollection (Assg ‚àÖ)

In one special case, we will need to manipulate contexts from the right, i.e. the outermost scope.

def 
Assg.extendBot: {Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí {Œì : List (Type u_1)} ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±])

Intrinsically Typed Representation of do Statements

where

  • m: base monad
  • œâ: return type, m œâ is the type of the entire do block
  • Œì: do-local immutable context
  • Œî: do-local mutable context
  • b: break allowed
  • c: continue allowed
  • Œ±: local result type, m Œ± is the type of the statement

The constructor signatures are best understood by comparing them with the corresponding typing rules in the paper. Note that the choice of de Bruijn indices changes/simplifies some parts, such as obviating freshness checks (x ‚àâ Œî).

inductive 
Stmt: (Type ‚Üí Type u) ‚Üí Type ‚Üí List Type ‚Üí List Type ‚Üí Bool ‚Üí Bool ‚Üí Type ‚Üí Type (max 1 u)
Stmt (
m: Type ‚Üí Type u
m : 
Type: Type 1
Type ‚Üí 
Type u: Type (u + 1)
Type u) (
œâ: Type
œâ : 
Type: Type 1
Type) : (
Œì: List Type
Œì 
Œî: List Type
Œî : 
List: Type 1 ‚Üí Type 1
List 
Type: Type 1
Type) ‚Üí (
b: Bool
b 
c: Bool
c : 
Bool: Type
Bool) ‚Üí (
Œ±: Type
Œ± : 
Type: Type 1
Type) ‚Üí 
Type _: Type ((max 1 u) + 1)
Type _ where
  | 
expr: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m Œ±) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±
expr (
e: Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m Œ±
e : 
Œì: List Type
Œì ‚ä¢ 
Œî: List Type
Œî ‚ä¢ 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u
m 
Œ±: Type
Œ±) : 
Stmt: (Type ‚Üí Type u) ‚Üí Type ‚Üí List Type ‚Üí List Type ‚Üí Bool ‚Üí Bool ‚Üí Type ‚Üí Type (max 1 u)
Stmt 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u
m 
œâ: Type
œâ 
Œì: List Type
Œì 
Œî: List Type
Œî 
b: Bool
b 
c: Bool
c 
Œ±: Type
Œ±
  |

We write e[œÅ][œÉ] for the substitution of both contexts in e, a simple application in this encoding. œÉ[x ‚Ü¶ v] updates œÉ at v (a de Bruijn index).

macro:max (priority := high) 
e: Lean.TSyntax `term
e:term:max noWs "[" 
œÅ: Lean.TSyntax `term
œÅ:term "]" "[" 
œÉ: Lean.TSyntax `term
œÉ:term "]" : term => `($
e: Lean.TSyntax `term
e $
œÅ: Lean.TSyntax `term
œÅ $
œÉ: Lean.TSyntax `term
œÉ)
macro:max (priority := high) 
œÉ: Lean.TSyntax `term
œÉ:term:max noWs "[" 
x: Lean.TSyntax `term
x:term " ‚Ü¶ " 
v: Lean.TSyntax `term
v:term "]" : term => `(HList.set $
œÉ: Lean.TSyntax `term
œÉ $
x: Lean.TSyntax `term
x $
v: Lean.TSyntax `term
v)

Dynamic Evaluation Function

A direct encoding of the paper's operational semantics as a denotational function, generalized over an arbitrary monad. Note that the immutable context œÅ is accumulated (v :: œÅ) and passed explicitly instead of immutable bindings being substituted immediately as that is a better match for the above definition of Stmt. Iteration over the values of the given list in the for case introduces a nested, mutually recursive helper function, with termination of the mutual bundle following from a size argument over the statement primarily and the length of the list in the for case secondarily.

@[simp] def 
Stmt.eval: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí
  {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí
    {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
      {Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m (Neut œâ Œ± b c √ó Assg Œî)
Stmt.eval [
Monad: (Type ?u.21808 ‚Üí Type ?u.21807) ‚Üí Type (max (?u.21808 + 1) ?u.21807)
Monad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m] (
œÅ: Assg Œì
œÅ : 
Assg: List Type ‚Üí Type
Assg 
Œì: List Type
Œì) :

eval: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí
  {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí
    {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
      {Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m (Neut œâ Œ± b c √ó Assg Œî)
eval 
œÅ: Assg Œì
œÅ 
œÉ: Assg Œî
œÉ >>= 
cont: (Œ±‚úù ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m (Neut œâ Œ± b c √ó Assg Œî)) ‚Üí Neut œâ Œ±‚úù b c √ó Assg Œî ‚Üí m (Neut œâ Œ± b c √ó Assg Œî)

v: Œ±‚úù
v 
œÉ': Assg Œî
œÉ' =>

length: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí Nat
length)

At the top-level statement, the contexts are empty, no loop control flow statements are allowed, and the return and result type are identical.

abbrev 
Do: (Type ‚Üí Type u_1) ‚Üí Type ‚Üí Type (max 1 u_1)

m 
Œ±: Type

def 
Do.eval: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Do m Œ± ‚Üí m Œ±

notation "‚ü¶" 
s: Lean.TSyntax `term

Translation Functions

We adjust the immutable context where necessary. The mutable context does not have to be adjusted.

@[simp] def

  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí

sbreak: {m : Type ‚Üí Type ?u.118585} ‚Üí {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî true c Œ±

scont: {m : Type ‚Üí Type ?u.118632} ‚Üí {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {b : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b true Œ±
scont => 
scont: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {b : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b true Œ±
scont

Let us write f ‚àò‚Çë e for the composition of f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤ with e : Œì ‚ä¢ Œî ‚ä¢ Œ±, which we will use to rewrite embedded terms.

infixr:90 " ‚àò‚Çë "  => fun f e => fun œÅ œÉ => f e[œÅ][œÉ]

The formalization of S creates some technical hurdles. Because it operates on the outer-most mutable binding, we have to operate on that context from the right, from which we lose some helpful definitional equalities and have to rewrite types using nested proofs instead.

The helper function shadowSnd is particularly interesting because it shows how the shadowing in translation rules (S2) and (S9) is expressed in our de Bruijn encoding: The context Œ± :: Œ≤ :: Œ± :: Œì corresponds, in this order, to the y that has just been bound to the value of get, then x from the respective rule, followed by the y of the outer scope. We encode the shadowing of y by dropping the third element from the context as well as the assignment. We are in fact forced to do so because the corresponding branches of S would not otherwise typecheck. The only mistake we could still make is to drop the wrong Œ± value from the assignment, which (speaking from experience) would eventually be caught by the correctness proof.

@[simp] def 
S: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí
          {Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì (List.append Œî [Œ±]) b c Œ≤ ‚Üí Stmt (StateT Œ± m) œâ (Œ± :: Œì) Œî b c Œ≤

m] :

/-(S4)-/     
Stmt.assg: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (x : Fin (List.length Œî)) ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí List.get Œî x) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Unit

x, 
h: x.val < List.length Œî
h‚ü© (fun (
y: Œ±
y :: 
œÅ: HList Œì
œÅ) 
œÉ: Assg Œî
œÉ => 
List.get_append_left: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type 1} {i : Nat} (as bs : List Œ±) (h : i < List.length as) {h' : i < List.length (as ++ bs)},
  List.get (as ++ bs) { val := i, isLt := h' } = List.get as { val := i, isLt := h }

e: Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚Üí List.get (List.append Œî [Œ±]) x
e

/-(S5)-/

    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí
        {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí Bool) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±

s‚ÇÇ: Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±

  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m Œ±) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±

ExceptT.lift: {Œµ : Type} ‚Üí {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí m Œ± ‚Üí ExceptT Œµ m Œ±

e: Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m Œ±
e)

e
  | 
Stmt.sfor: {m : Type ‚Üí Type ?u.279621} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí List Œ±) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ (Œ± :: Œì) Œî true true Unit ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Unit
Stmt.sfor 
e: Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí List Œ±‚úù
e 
s: Stmt m œâ (Œ±‚úù :: Œì) Œî true true Unit
s => 
Stmt.sfor: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí List Œ±) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ (Œ± :: Œì) Œî true true Unit ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Unit
Stmt.sfor 
e: Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí List Œ±‚úù
e (
L: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt (ExceptT Unit m) œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±
L 
s: Stmt m œâ (Œ±‚úù :: Œì) Œî true true Unit
s)

The remaining function to be translated is D, which is straightforward as well except for its termination proof, as it recurses on the results of S (D3) and C ‚àò B (D5). Because of rules (S2, S9) that introduce new bindings, S may in fact increase the size of the input, and the same is true for C and B for the sizeOf function automatically generated by Lean. Thus we introduce a new measure numExts that counts the number of special statements on top of basic do notation and prove that all three functions do not increase the size according to that measure. Because the rules (D3) and (D5) each eliminate such a special statement, it follows that D terminates because either the number of special statements decreases in each case, or it remains the same and the total number of statements decreases.

@[simp] def 
Stmt.numExts: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Nat

@[simp] theorem 
Stmt.numExts_mapAssg: ‚àÄ {Œì' Œì : List Type} {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {œâ : Type} {Œî : List Type} {b c : Bool} {Œ≤ : Type} (f : Assg Œì' ‚Üí Assg Œì)

b‚úù, c‚úù: Bool
e‚úù: Assg Œì‚úù ‚Üí Assg Œî‚úù ‚Üí List Œ±‚úù
s‚úù: Stmt m œâ (Œ±‚úù :: Œì‚úù) Œî‚úù true true Unit
Œì': List Type
f: Assg Œì' ‚Üí Assg Œì‚úù
numExts (mapAssg f (sfor e‚úù s‚úù)) = numExts (sfor e‚úù s‚úù)
Œì: List Type
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
œâ: Type
Œî: List Type
b, c: Bool
Œ≤: Type
Œì‚úù, Œî‚úù: List Type
c‚úù: Bool
Œ±‚úù: Type
Œì': List Type
f: Assg Œì' ‚Üí Assg Œì‚úù
numExts (mapAssg f sbreak) = numExts sbreak
Œì: List Type
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
œâ: Type
Œî: List Type
b, c: Bool
Œ≤: Type
Œì‚úù, Œî‚úù: List Type
b‚úù: Bool
Œ±‚úù: Type
Œì': List Type
f: Assg Œì' ‚Üí Assg Œì‚úù
numExts (mapAssg f scont) = numExts scont
 
Goals accomplished! üêô


theorem 
Stmt.numExts_S: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type} {œâ : Type} {Œì Œî : List Type} {Œ± : Type} {b c : Bool} {Œ≤ : Type} [inst : Monad m]

-- Auxiliary tactic for showing that `D` terminates
macro "D_tac" : tactic =>
  `({simp_wf
     solve
      | apply Prod.Lex.left; assumption
      | apply Prod.Lex.right' <;> simp_arith })

Stmt.ite: {m : Type ‚Üí Type ?u.350351} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí
        {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí Bool) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±
Stmt.ite

e 
s‚ÇÅ: Stmt m Empty Œì ‚àÖ false false Œ±

œÅ: Assg Œì

Stmt.sfor: {m : Type ‚Üí Type ?u.350515} ‚Üí

Nat.lt_succ_of_le: ‚àÄ {n m : Nat}, n ‚â§ m ‚Üí n < Nat.succ m

runCatch: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí ExceptT Œ± m Œ± ‚Üí m Œ±

Goals accomplished! üêô

Finally we compose D and R into the translation rule for a top-level statement (1').

def 
Do.trans: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Do m Œ± ‚Üí m Œ±
Do.trans [
Monad: (Type ‚Üí Type) ‚Üí Type 1
Monad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m] (
s: Do m Œ±
s : 
Do: (Type ‚Üí Type) ‚Üí Type ‚Üí Type 1
Do 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m 
Œ±: Type
Œ±) : 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m 
Œ±: Type
Œ± := 
runCatch: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí ExceptT Œ± m Œ± ‚Üí m Œ±
runCatch (
D: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Stmt m Empty Œì ‚àÖ false false Œ± ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí m Œ±
D (
R: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt (ExceptT œâ m) Empty Œì Œî b c Œ±

s: Do m Œ±

‚àÖ: Assg ‚àÖ
‚àÖ)

Equivalence Proof

Using the monadic dynamic semantics, we can modularly prove for each individual translation function that evaluating its output is equivalent to directly evaluating the input, modulo some lifting and adjustment of resulting values. After induction on the statement, the proofs are mostly concerned with case splitting, application of congruence theorems, and simplification. We can mostly offload these tasks onto Aesop.

attribute [local simp] 
map_eq_pure_bind: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œ± Œ≤ : Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (f : Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤) (x : m Œ±),
  f <$> x = do
    let a ‚Üê x
    pure (f a)
map_eq_pure_bind 
ExceptT.run_bind: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œµ Œ± Œ≤ : Type u_1} {f : Œ± ‚Üí ExceptT Œµ m Œ≤} [inst : Monad m] (x : ExceptT Œµ m Œ±),
  ExceptT.run (x >>= f) = do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.run x
    match x with
      | Except.ok x => ExceptT.run (f x)
      | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
ExceptT.run_bind
attribute [aesop safe apply] 
bind_congr: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œ± Œ≤ : Type u_1} [inst : Bind m] {x : m Œ±} {f g : Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤},
  (‚àÄ (a : Œ±), f a = g a) ‚Üí x >>= f = x >>= g
bind_congr

theorem 
eval_R: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {œâ : Type} {Œì Œî : List Type} {b c : Bool} {Œ± : Type} {œÅ : Assg Œì} {œÉ : Assg Œî} [inst : Monad m]
  [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (s : Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±),
  Stmt.eval œÅ (R s) œÉ = do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ s œÉ)
    match b, c, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, snd) => throw o
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)
eval_R [

Stmt.eval œÅ (R s) œÉ = do
  let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ s œÉ)
  match b, c, x with
    | b, c, (Neut.ret o, snd) => throw o
    | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
    | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
    | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)

h
ExceptT.run (Stmt.eval œÅ (R s) œÉ) =
  ExceptT.run do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ s œÉ)
    match b, c, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, snd) => throw o
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)

      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)

  ExceptT.run do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ (Stmt.sfor e s‚úù) œÉ)
    match b‚úù, c‚úù, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, snd) => throw o
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)

ExceptT.run (Stmt.eval.go œÅ c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù (R s‚úù) œÉ (e œÅ œÉ)) =
  ExceptT.run do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval.go œÅ c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù s‚úù œÉ (e œÅ œÉ))
    match b‚úù, c‚úù, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, snd) => throw o
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)

ExceptT.run (Stmt.eval.go œÅ c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù (R s‚úù) œÉ []) =
  ExceptT.run do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval.go œÅ c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù s‚úù œÉ [])
    match b‚úù, c‚úù, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, snd) => throw o
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
œâ: Type
Œì, Œî: List Type
b, c: Bool
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
Œì‚úù, Œî‚úù: List Type
Œ±‚úù: Type
b‚úù, c‚úù: Bool
e: Assg Œì‚úù ‚Üí Assg Œî‚úù ‚Üí List Œ±‚úù
s‚úù: Stmt m œâ (Œ±‚úù :: Œì‚úù) Œî‚úù true true Unit
œÅ: Assg Œì‚úù
head‚úù: Œ±‚úù
tail‚úù: List Œ±‚úù
œÉ: Assg Œî‚úù
ExceptT.run (Stmt.eval.go œÅ c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù (R s‚úù) œÉ (head‚úù :: tail‚úù)) =
  ExceptT.run do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval.go œÅ c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù s‚úù œÉ (head‚úù :: tail‚úù))
    match b‚úù, c‚úù, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, snd) => throw o
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)
 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
œâ: Type
Œì, Œî: List Type
b, c: Bool

œÅ: Assg Œì‚úù
œÉ: Assg Œî‚úù

      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rbreak, œÉ)

We need one last helper function on context bottoms to be able to state the invariant of S, and then prove various lemmas about their interactions.

def 
Assg.bot: {Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œì : List (Type u_1)} ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±]) ‚Üí Œ±
Assg.bot : {
Œì: List (Type u_1)
Œì : 
_: Type (u_1 + 1)
_} ‚Üí

Assg (
Œì: List (Type u_1)
Œì ++ [
Œ±: Type u_1
Œ±]) ‚Üí 
Œ±: Type u_1
Œ±
  | [],     [
a: Œ±
a]     => 
a: Œ±
a
  | _ :: 
_: List (Type u_1)
_, _ :: 
as: HList (List.append tail‚úù [Œ±])
as =>

bot

as

@[simp] theorem 
Assg.dropBot_extendBot: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {Œì : List (Type u_1)} (a : Œ±) (œÉ : Assg Œì), dropBot (extendBot a œÉ) = œÉ

@[simp] theorem 
Assg.bot_extendBot: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {Œì : List (Type u_1)} (a : Œ±) (œÉ : Assg Œì), bot (extendBot a œÉ) = a
Assg.bot_extendBot (
a: Œ±
a : 
Œ±: Type u_1
Œ±) (

@[simp] theorem

@[simp] theorem 
Assg.dropBot_set_extendBot_init: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {Œì : List (Type u_1)} {i : Fin (List.length (List.append Œì [Œ±]))} (a : Œ±) (œÉ : Assg Œì)
  (h : i.val < List.length Œì) {b : List.get (List.append Œì [Œ±]) i},
  dropBot (HList.set (extendBot a œÉ) i b) =
    HList.set œÉ { val := i.val, isLt := h }
      ((_ :
          List.get (Œì ++ [Œ±]) { val := i.val, isLt := (_ : i.val < List.length (Œì ++ [Œ±])) } =
            List.get Œì { val := i.val, isLt := h }) ‚ñ∏
        b)

tail‚úù: List (Type u_1)

  {b : List.get (List.append tail‚úù [Œ±]) i},

        b)

@[simp] theorem

@[simp] theorem 
Assg.bot_set_extendBot_bottom: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {Œì : List (Type u_1)} {i : Fin (List.length (List.append Œì [Œ±]))} (a : Œ±) (œÉ : Assg Œì),
  ¬¨i.val < List.length Œì ‚Üí
    ‚àÄ {b : List.get (List.append Œì [Œ±]) i}, bot (HList.set (extendBot a œÉ) i b) = cast (_ : List.get (Œì ++ [Œ±]) i = Œ±) b
Assg.bot_set_extendBot_bottom (
a: Œ±
a : 
Œ±: Type u_1
Œ±) (
œÉ: Assg Œì
œÉ : 
Assg: List (Type u_1) ‚Üí Type u_1
Assg 
Œì: List (Type u_1)
Œì) (
h: ¬¨i.val < List.length Œì
h : ¬¨ 
i: Fin (List.length (List.append Œì [Œ±]))
i.
1: {n : Nat} ‚Üí Fin n ‚Üí Nat
1 < 
Œì: List (Type u_1)
Œì.
length: {Œ± : Type (u_1 + 1)} ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí Nat
length) {
b: List.get (List.append Œì [Œ±]) i
b} : 
Assg.bot: {Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œì : List (Type u_1)} ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±]) ‚Üí Œ±
Assg.bot ((
Assg.extendBot: {Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí {Œì : List (Type u_1)} ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±])
Assg.extendBot 
a: Œ±
a 
œÉ: Assg Œì
œÉ).
set: {Œ±s : List (Type u_1)} ‚Üí HList Œ±s ‚Üí (i : Fin (List.length Œ±s)) ‚Üí List.get Œ±s i ‚Üí HList Œ±s
set 
i: Fin (List.length (List.append Œì [Œ±]))
i 
b: List.get (List.append Œì [Œ±]) i
b) = 
cast: {Œ± Œ≤ : Type u_1} ‚Üí Œ± = Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤
cast (
List.get_last: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type (u_1 + 1)} {a : Œ±} {as : List Œ±} {i : Fin (List.length (as ++ [a]))},
  ¬¨i.val < List.length as ‚Üí List.get (as ++ [a]) i = a
List.get_last 
h: ¬¨i.val < List.length Œì
h) 
b: List.get (List.append Œì [Œ±]) i
b := 
Œ±: Type u_1
Œì: List (Type u_1)
i: Fin (List.length (List.append Œì [Œ±]))
a: Œ±
œÉ: Assg Œì
h: ¬¨i.val < List.length Œì
b: List.get (List.append Œì [Œ±]) i
bot (HList.set (extendBot a œÉ) i b) = cast (_ : List.get (Œì ++ [Œ±]) i = Œ±) b

  
Œ±: Type u_1
Œì: List (Type u_1)
i: Fin (List.length (List.append Œì [Œ±]))
a: Œ±
œÉ: Assg Œì
h: ¬¨i.val < List.length Œì
b: List.get (List.append Œì [Œ±]) i
bot (HList.set (extendBot a œÉ) i b) = cast (_ : List.get (Œì ++ [Œ±]) i = Œ±) b

  
Œ±: Type u_1
a: Œ±

theorem 
eval_S: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type} {œâ : Type} {Œì Œî : List Type} {Œ± : Type} {b c : Bool} {Œ≤ : Type} {a : Œ±} {œÅ : HList Œì} {œÉ : Assg Œî}
  [inst : Monad m] [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (s : Stmt m œâ Œì (List.append Œî [Œ±]) b c Œ≤),
  StateT.run (Stmt.eval (a :: œÅ) (S s) œÉ) a = do
    let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s (Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
    match x with
      | (r, œÉ) => pure (r :: Assg.dropBot œÉ, Assg.bot œÉ)
eval_S [
Monad: (Type ?u.552273 ‚Üí Type ?u.552272) ‚Üí Type (max (?u.552273 + 1) ?u.552272)
Monad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m] [
LawfulMonad: (m : Type ‚Üí Type) ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Prop
LawfulMonad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m] : ‚àÄ (
s: Stmt m œâ Œì (List.append Œî [Œ±]) b c Œ≤
s : 
Stmt: (Type ‚Üí Type) ‚Üí Type ‚Üí List Type ‚Üí List Type ‚Üí Bool ‚Üí Bool ‚Üí Type ‚Üí Type 1
Stmt 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m 
œâ: Type
œâ 
Œì: List Type
Œì (
Œî: List Type
Œî ++ [
Œ±: Type
Œ±]) 
b: Bool
b 
c: Bool
c 
Œ≤: Type
Œ≤), 
StateT.run: {œÉ : Type} ‚Üí {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí StateT œÉ m Œ± ‚Üí œÉ ‚Üí m (Œ± √ó œÉ)
StateT.run ((
S: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí
          {Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì (List.append Œî [Œ±]) b c Œ≤ ‚Üí Stmt (StateT Œ± m) œâ (Œ± :: Œì) Œî b c Œ≤
S 
s: Stmt m œâ Œì (List.append Œî [Œ±]) b c Œ≤
s).
eval: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí
    {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
      {Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m (Neut œâ Œ± b c √ó Assg Œî)
eval (
a: Œ±
a :: 
œÅ: HList Œì
œÅ) 
œÉ: Assg Œî
œÉ) 
a: Œ±
a = 
s: Stmt m œâ Œì (List.append Œî [Œ±]) b c Œ≤
s.
eval: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí
    {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
      {Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m (Neut œâ Œ± b c √ó Assg Œî)
eval 
œÅ: HList Œì
œÅ (
Assg.extendBot: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±])
Assg.extendBot 
a: Œ±
a 
œÉ: Assg Œî
œÉ) >>= fun
    | 
r: Neut œâ Œ≤ b c
r :: 
œÉ: HList (List.append Œî [Œ±])
œÉ => 
pure: {f : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí [self : Pure f] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí f Œ±
pure ((
r: Neut œâ Œ≤ b c
r :: 
Assg.dropBot: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±]) ‚Üí Assg Œì
Assg.dropBot 
œÉ: HList (List.append Œî [Œ±])
œÉ), 
Assg.bot: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí {Œì : List Type} ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±]) ‚Üí Œ±
Assg.bot 
œÉ: HList (List.append Œî [Œ±])
œÉ) := 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
œâ: Type
Œì, Œî: List Type
Œ±: Type
b, c: Bool
Œ≤: Type
a: Œ±
œÅ: HList Œì
œÉ: Assg Œî
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
‚àÄ (s : Stmt m œâ Œì (List.append Œî [Œ±]) b c Œ≤),
  StateT.run (Stmt.eval (a :: œÅ) (S s) œÉ) a = do
    let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s (Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
    match x with
      | (r, œÉ) => pure (r :: Assg.dropBot œÉ, Assg.bot œÉ)

  
m: Type ‚Üí Type
œâ: Type
Œì, Œî: List Type
Œ±: Type
b, c: Bool
Œ≤: Type
a: Œ±
œÅ: HList Œì
œÉ: Assg Œî
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
‚àÄ {Œî' : List Type} (s : Stmt m œâ Œì Œî' b c Œ≤) (h : Œî' = List.append Œî [Œ±]),
  StateT.run (Stmt.eval (a :: œÅ) (S (h ‚ñ∏ s)) œÉ) a = do
    let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = Œî') ‚ñ∏ Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
    match x with
      | (r, œÉ) => pure (r :: Assg.dropBot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ), Assg.bot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ))

  
m: Type ‚Üí Type
œâ: Type
Œì, Œî: List Type
Œ±: Type
b, c: Bool
Œ≤: Type
a: Œ±
œÅ: HList Œì
œÉ: Assg Œî
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m

s: Stmt m œâ Œì Œî' b c Œ≤
h: Œî' = List.append Œî [Œ±]
StateT.run (Stmt.eval (a :: œÅ) (S (h ‚ñ∏ s)) œÉ) a = do
  let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = Œî') ‚ñ∏ Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
  match x with
    | (r, œÉ) => pure (r :: Assg.dropBot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ), Assg.bot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ))

ite

    | (r, œÉ) =>

          Assg.bot ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ œÉ))

ih: ‚àÄ {Œî_1 : List Type} {a : Œ±} {œÅ : HList (Œ±‚úù :: Œì‚úù)} {œÉ : Assg Œî_1} (h : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî_1 [Œ±]),

    let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s ((_ : List.append Œî_1 [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
    match x with
      | (r, œÉ) => pure (r :: Assg.dropBot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ), Assg.bot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ))

  let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ (Stmt.sfor e s) ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
  match x with
    | (r, œÉ) =>
      pure
        (r :: Assg.dropBot ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ œÉ),
          Assg.bot ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ œÉ))

    
m: Type ‚Üí Type
œâ: Type
Œì: List Type
Œ±: Type

Œ≤: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
Œî', Œì‚úù: List Type
Œ±‚úù: Type
b‚úù, c‚úù: Bool
Œî: List Type
a: Œ±
œÅ: HList Œì‚úù
œÉ: Assg Œî
e: Assg Œì‚úù ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚Üí List Œ±‚úù
s: Stmt m œâ (Œ±‚úù :: Œì‚úù) (List.append Œî [Œ±]) true true Unit
ih: ‚àÄ (a : Œ±) (œÅ : HList (Œ±‚úù :: Œì‚úù)) (œÉ : Assg Œî),
  StateT.run (Stmt.eval (a :: œÅ) (S ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ s)) œÉ) a = do
    let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
    match x with
      | (r, œÉ) =>
        pure
          (r :: Assg.dropBot ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ œÉ),
            Assg.bot ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ œÉ))
sfor
StateT.run (Stmt.eval (a :: œÅ) (S ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ Stmt.sfor e s)) œÉ) a = do
  let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ (Stmt.sfor e s) ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
  match x with
    | (r, œÉ) =>
      pure
        (r :: Assg.dropBot ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ œÉ),
          Assg.bot ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ œÉ))

ih: ‚àÄ (a : Œ±) (œÅ : HList (Œ±‚úù :: Œì‚úù)) (œÉ : Assg Œî),
  StateT.run (Stmt.eval (a :: œÅ) (S ((_ : List.append Œî [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ s)) œÉ) a = do

StateT.run
    (Stmt.eval.go (a :: œÅ) c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù (Stmt.bind (Stmt.expr fun x x => get) (Stmt.mapAssg S.shadowSnd (S s))) œÉ
      (e œÅ (Assg.extendBot a œÉ)))
    a =
  do
  let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval.go œÅ c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù s (Assg.extendBot a œÉ) (e œÅ (Assg.extendBot a œÉ))
  pure (x.fst :: Assg.dropBot x.snd, Assg.bot x.snd)

    let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s ((_ : List.append Œî_1 [Œ±] = List.append Œî [Œ±]) ‚ñ∏ Assg.extendBot a œÉ)
    match x with
      | (r, œÉ) => pure (r :: Assg.dropBot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ), Assg.bot (h ‚ñ∏ œÉ))

    (Stmt.eval.go (a :: œÅ) c‚úù b‚úù Œ±‚úù (Stmt.bind (Stmt.expr fun x x => get) (Stmt.mapAssg S.shadowSnd (S s))) œÉ

theorem 
HList.eq_nil: ‚àÄ (as : HList ‚àÖ), as = ‚àÖ
HList.eq_nil (
as: HList ‚àÖ
as : 
HList: List (Type u_1) ‚Üí Type u_1
HList 
‚àÖ: List (Type u_1)
‚àÖ) : 
as: HList ‚àÖ
as = ‚àÖ := 
rfl: ‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} {a : Œ±}, a = a
rfl

attribute [local simp] 
ExceptT.run_bind: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {Œµ Œ± Œ≤ : Type u_1} {f : Œ± ‚Üí ExceptT Œµ m Œ≤} [inst : Monad m] (x : ExceptT Œµ m Œ±),
  ExceptT.run (x >>= f) = do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.run x
    match x with
      | Except.ok x => ExceptT.run (f x)
      | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
ExceptT.run_bind

theorem 
eval_B: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {œâ : Type} {Œì Œî : List Type} {b c : Bool} {Œ± : Type} {œÅ : Assg Œì} {œÉ : Assg Œî} [inst : Monad m]
  [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (s : Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±),
  Stmt.eval œÅ (B s) œÉ = do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ s œÉ)
    match b, c, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, œÉ) => pure (Neut.ret o, œÉ)
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, snd) => throw ()
eval_B [

throw: {Œµ : Type} ‚Üí {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí [self : MonadExcept Œµ m] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œµ ‚Üí m Œ±

ExceptT

Unit 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
m (

Neut 
œâ: Type
œâ 
Œ±: Type
Œ±

false 
c: Bool
c √ó 
Assg: List Type ‚Üí Type
Assg 
Œî: List Type
Œî)) := 
m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
œâ: Type
Œì, Œî: List Type
b, c: Bool
Œ±: Type
œÅ: Assg Œì
œÉ: Assg Œî
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
s: Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±
Stmt.eval œÅ (B s) œÉ = do
  let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ s œÉ)
  match b, c, x with
    | b, c, (Neut.ret o, œÉ) => pure (Neut.ret o, œÉ)
    | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
    | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
    | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, snd) => throw ()

œÉ: Assg Œî
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
s: Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±
h
ExceptT.run (Stmt.eval œÅ (B s) œÉ) =
  ExceptT.run do
    let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ s œÉ)
    match b, c, x with
      | b, c, (Neut.ret o, œÉ) => pure (Neut.ret o, œÉ)
      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)
      | .(true), c, (Neut.rbreak, snd) => throw ()

      | b, c, (Neut.val a, œÉ) => pure (Neut.val a, œÉ)
      | b, .(true), (Neut.rcont, œÉ) => pure (Neut.rcont, œÉ)

theorem 
eval_C: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} {œâ : Type} {Œì Œî : List Type} {c : Bool} {Œ± : Type} {œÅ : Assg Œì} {œÉ : Assg Œî} [inst : Monad m]

‚àÄ (s : Stmt m œâ Œì Œî false c Œ±), Stmt.eval œÅ (C s) œÉ = ExceptT.lift (Stmt.eval œÅ s œÉ) >>= throwOnContinue

m: Type ‚Üí Type u_1
œâ: Type
Œì, Œî: List Type
c: Bool
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
b': Bool
Œì‚úù, Œî‚úù: List Type
c‚úù: Bool
Œ±‚úù, Œ≤‚úù: Type
œÅ: Assg Œì‚úù
œÉ: Assg Œî‚úù
s‚úù: Stmt m œâ Œì‚úù Œî‚úù false c‚úù Œ±‚úù
s'‚úù: Stmt m œâ (Œ±‚úù :: Œì‚úù) Œî‚úù false c‚úù Œ≤‚úù
bind
let s := (_ : false = false) ‚ñ∏ Stmt.bind s‚úù s'‚úù;

Œì: List Type
œÅ: Assg Œì

Œ±: Type
e: Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg ‚àÖ ‚Üí Bool
s‚ÇÅ, s‚ÇÇ: Stmt m Empty Œì ‚àÖ false false Œ±
(if e œÅ ‚àÖ = true then D s‚ÇÅ œÅ else D s‚ÇÇ œÅ) = do
  let x ‚Üê if e œÅ ‚àÖ = true then Stmt.eval œÅ s‚ÇÅ ‚àÖ else Stmt.eval œÅ s‚ÇÇ ‚àÖ
  match x with
    | (Neut.val a, snd) => pure a

Œ±: Type

s‚ÇÅ, s‚ÇÇ: Stmt m Empty Œì ‚àÖ false false Œ±
D s‚ÇÇ œÅ = do
  let x ‚Üê Stmt.eval œÅ s‚ÇÇ ‚àÖ
  match x with
    | (Neut.val a, snd) => pure a
 
Goals accomplished! üêô

  |

The equivalence proof cited in the paper follows from the invariants of D and R.

theorem 
Do.trans_eq_eval: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type} {Œ± : Type} [inst : Monad m] [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (s : Do m Œ±), trans s = ‚ü¶s‚üß

m: Type ‚Üí Type
m] : ‚àÄ 
s: Do m Œ±
s :

Do 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m 
Œ±: Type
Œ±,

Goals accomplished! üêô

Partial Evaluation

We define a new term notation simp [...] in e that rewrites the term e using the given simplification theorems.

open Lean in
open Lean.Parser.Tactic in
open Lean.Meta in
open Lean.Elab in
elab "simp" "[" 
simps: Syntax.TSepArray `Lean.Parser.Tactic.simpLemma ","
simps:
simpLemma: ParserDescr
simpLemma,* "]" "in" 
e: TSyntax `term
e:term : term => do
  -- construct goal `‚ä¢ e = ?x` with fresh metavariable `?x`, simplify, solve by reflexivity,
  -- and return assigned value of `?x`
  let 
e: Expr
e ‚Üê

Term.elabTermAndSynthesize 
e: TSyntax `term
e 
none: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Option Œ±
none

x: Expr
x ‚Üê

mkFreshExprMVar 
(‚Üê inferType e): Expr
(‚Üê 
inferType: Expr ‚Üí MetaM Expr

(‚Üê inferType e): Expr

(‚Üê inferType e): Expr

  let 
goal: Expr

-- further clean up generated programs
attribute [local simp] 
Assg.extendBot: {Œ± : Type u_1} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí {Œì : List (Type u_1)} ‚Üí Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg (List.append Œì [Œ±])
Assg.extendBot 
cast: {Œ± Œ≤ : Sort u} ‚Üí Œ± = Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤
cast
attribute [-simp] 
StateT.run'_eq: ‚àÄ {m : Type u_1 ‚Üí Type u_2} {œÉ Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : Monad m] (x : StateT œÉ m Œ±) (s : œÉ),
  StateT.run' x s = (fun a => a.fst) <$> StateT.run x s
StateT.run'_eq

We can now use this new notation to completely erase the translation functions from an invocation on the example ex2 from For.lean (manually translated to Stmt).

/-
let mut y := init;
for x in xs do' {
  y ‚Üê f y x
};
return y
-/

def 
ex2': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ≤ Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
ex2' [
Monad: (Type ?u.1085514 ‚Üí Type ?u.1085513) ‚Üí Type (max (?u.1085514 + 1) ?u.1085513)
Monad

f: Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤

  simp [Do.trans] in 
Do.trans: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Do m Œ± ‚Üí m Œ±

Stmt.letmut: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí

      {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí Œ±) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì (Œ± :: Œî) b c Œ≤ ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ≤

init: Œ≤

Stmt.bind: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt m œâ (Œ± :: Œì) Œî b c Œ≤ ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ≤
Stmt.bind (
        
Stmt.sfor: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí
        {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí List Œ±) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ (Œ± :: Œì) Œî true true Unit ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Unit
Stmt.sfor (fun _ _ => 
xs: List Œ±
xs) <|
        -- `y ‚Üê f y x` unfolded to `let z ‚Üê f y x; y := z` (A4)
        
Stmt.bind: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ± ‚Üí Stmt m œâ (Œ± :: Œì) Œî b c Œ≤ ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ≤

Stmt.expr: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí m Œ±) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±

y

Stmt.assg: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí
    {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí
      {b c : Bool} ‚Üí (x : Fin (List.length Œî)) ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí List.get Œî x) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Unit
Stmt.assg ‚ü®
0: Nat
0,

Goals accomplished! üêô
‚ü© (fun ([
z: Œ≤
z, 
Warning: unused variable `x`
]) _ => 
z: Œ≤
z))) <|
      
Stmt.ret: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí
  {œâ : Type} ‚Üí {Œì Œî : List Type} ‚Üí {b c : Bool} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí (Assg Œì ‚Üí Assg Œî ‚Üí œâ) ‚Üí Stmt m œâ Œì Œî b c Œ±
Stmt.ret (fun _ ([
y: Œ≤
y]) => 
y: Œ≤
y))

Compare the output of the two versions - the structure is identical except for unused monadic layers in the formal translation, which would be harder to avoid in this typed approach.

def ex2.{u_1} : {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí {Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤ :=
fun {m} {Œ±} [Monad m] {Œ≤} f init xs =>
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch
    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        forM xs fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
        let y ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw y))
      y)
 
ex2: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí {Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
ex2

def ex2' : {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ≤ Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤ :=
fun {m} {Œ≤ Œ±} [Monad m] f init xs =>
  runCatch
    (let x := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        runCatch
            (forM xs fun x =>
              runCatch do
                let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift get)
                let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (StateT.lift (ExceptT.lift (f x_1 x))))
                let _ ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift get)
                ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (set x)))
        let x ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw x))
      x)
 
ex2': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ≤ Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
ex2'

We can evaluate the generated program like any other Lean program, and prove that both versions are equivalent.

3

 
ex2': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ≤ Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
ex2' (m := 
Id: Type ‚Üí Type
Id) (fun 
a: Nat
a 
b: Nat
b => 
pure: {f : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí [self : Pure f] ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí f Œ±

a: Nat
a + 
b: Nat
b)) 
0: Nat
0 [
1: Nat
1, 
2: Nat
2]


example: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type} {Œ≤ Œ± : Type} {init : Œ≤} {xs : List Œ±} [inst : Monad m] [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (f : Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤),
  ex2' f init xs = ex2 f init xs

ex2': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ≤ Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤

ex2: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí {Œ≤ : Type} ‚Üí (Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤) ‚Üí Œ≤ ‚Üí List Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤

m: Type ‚Üí Type

ex2' f init xs = ex2 f init xs

  
m: Type ‚Üí Type
Œ≤, Œ±: Type

ex2' f init xs = ex2 f init xs
m: Type ‚Üí Type
Œ≤, Œ±: Type
init: Œ≤
xs: List Œ±
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
f: Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
ex2' f init xs =
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch
    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        forM xs fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get
            set y
        let y ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw y))
      y)

Œ≤, Œ±: Type
init: Œ≤
xs: List Œ±
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
f: Œ≤ ‚Üí Œ± ‚Üí m Œ≤
runCatch
    (let x := init;
    StateT.run'
      (do
        runCatch
            (forM xs fun x =>
              runCatch do
                let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift get)
                let x ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (StateT.lift (ExceptT.lift (f x_1 x))))
                let _ ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift get)
                ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (set x)))
        let x ‚Üê get
        StateT.lift (throw x))
      x) =
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch
    (let y := init;
    StateT.run'

        forM xs fun x => do
            let y ‚Üê get
            let y ‚Üê StateT.lift (ExceptCpsT.lift (f y x))
            let _ ‚Üê get

      ExceptT.run
          (let x := init;
          StateT.run'
            (do

                let x ‚Üê
                  ExceptT.run
                      (forM xs fun x => do
                        let x ‚Üê

                              let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift get)

                          | Except.ok x => pure x
                          | Except.error e => pure e)

Goals accomplished! üêô

For one more example, consider ex3 from For.lean.

/-
for xs in xss do' {
  for x in xs do' {
    let b ‚Üê p x;
    if b then {
      return some x
    }
  }
};
pure none
-/

def 
ex3': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3' [

Stmt.expr (fun _ _ =>

none: {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí Option Œ±

def ex3.{u_1} : {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±) :=
fun {m} {Œ±} [Monad m] p xss =>
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM xss fun xs =>
        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)
 
ex3: {m : Type ‚Üí Type u_1} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3

def ex3' : {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±) :=
fun {m} {Œ±} [Monad m] p xss =>
  runCatch do
    runCatch
        (forM xss fun x =>
          runCatch
            (runCatch
              (forM x fun x =>
                runCatch do
                  let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (p x)))))
                  if x_1 = true then ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (throw (some x)))))
                    else ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (pure ()))))))))
    ExceptT.lift (pure none)
 
ex3': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3'

some 2

 
ex3': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3' (m := 
Id: Type ‚Üí Type
Id) (fun 
n: Nat
n => 
n: Nat
n % 
2: Nat
2 == 
0: Nat
0) [[
1: Nat
1, 
3: Nat
3], [
2: Nat
2, 
4: Nat
4]]


example: ‚àÄ {m : Type ‚Üí Type} {Œ± : Type} [inst : Monad m] [inst_1 : LawfulMonad m] (p : Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) (xss : List (List Œ±)),
  ex3' p xss = ex3 p xss
example [
Monad: (Type ‚Üí Type) ‚Üí Type 1
Monad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m] [
LawfulMonad: (m : Type ?u.1130706 ‚Üí Type ?u.1130705) ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí Prop
LawfulMonad 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m] (
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p : 
Œ±: Type
Œ± ‚Üí 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
m 
Bool: Type
Bool) (
xss: List (List Œ±)
xss : 
List: Type ‚Üí Type
List (
List: Type ‚Üí Type
List 
Œ±: Type
Œ±)) :
    
ex3': {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3' 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p 
xss: List (List Œ±)
xss = 
ex3: {m : Type ‚Üí Type} ‚Üí {Œ± : Type} ‚Üí [inst : Monad m] ‚Üí (Œ± ‚Üí m Bool) ‚Üí List (List Œ±) ‚Üí m (Option Œ±)
ex3 
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
p 
xss: List (List Œ±)
xss := 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
ex3' p xss = ex3 p xss

  
m: Type ‚Üí Type
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
ex3' p xss = ex3 p xss
m: Type ‚Üí Type
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
ex3' p xss =
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM xss fun xs =>
        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)
 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
(runCatch do
    runCatch
        (forM xss fun x =>
          runCatch
            (runCatch
              (forM x fun x =>
                runCatch do
                  let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (p x)))))
                  if x_1 = true then ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (throw (some x)))))
                    else ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (pure ()))))))))
    ExceptT.lift (pure none)) =
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM xss fun xs =>
        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)

      ExceptT.run do
          do
            let x ‚Üê
              ExceptT.run
                  (forM xss fun x => do

                      ExceptT.run do
                          let x ‚Üê
                            ExceptT.run

                                        let x_1 ‚Üê

                                        if x_1 = true then

                                          else
                                            ExceptT.lift
                                              (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (pure ())))))

                                    | Except.ok x => pure x
                                    | Except.error e => pure e)

      | Except.ok x => pure x

(do
    let x ‚Üê
      ExceptT.run

            (ExceptT.run

                (forM xs fun x => do
                  let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (p x))))

                    | Except.ok x => pure x

                | Except.ok x => do

head‚úù: Œ±
tail‚úù: List Œ±
(do
    let x ‚Üê
      ExceptT.run
          (ExceptT.run
            (ExceptT.run
              (ExceptT.run
                (forM (head‚úù :: tail‚úù) fun x => do
                  let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (p x))))
                  let x ‚Üê
                    ExceptT.run
                        (if x_1 = true then ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (throw (some x)))))
                        else pure ())
                  match x with
                    | Except.ok x => pure x
                    | Except.error x => pure x))))
    let x ‚Üê
      match x with
        | Except.ok x => do
          let x ‚Üê
            ExceptT.run
                (match x with
                | Except.ok x => do
                  let x ‚Üê
                    ExceptT.run
                        (match x with
                        | Except.ok x =>
                          ExceptT.run
                            (match x with
                            | Except.ok x => pure x
                            | Except.error x => pure x)
                        | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e))
                  match x with
                    | Except.ok x => do
                      let x ‚Üê
                        ExceptT.run
                            (match x with
                            | Except.ok x => pure x
                            | Except.error x => pure x)
                      match x with
                        | Except.ok x =>
                          ExceptT.run
                            (forM xss fun x => do
                              let x ‚Üê
                                ExceptT.run
                                    (ExceptT.run
                                      (forM x fun x => do
                                        let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (p x))))
                                        let x ‚Üê
                                          ExceptT.run
                                              (if x_1 = true then
                                                ExceptT.lift
                                                  (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (throw (some x)))))
                                              else pure ())
                                        match x with
                                          | Except.ok x => pure x
                                          | Except.error x => pure x))
                              let x ‚Üê
                                match x with
                                  | Except.ok x =>
                                    ExceptT.run
                                      (match x with
                                      | Except.ok x => pure x
                                      | Except.error x => pure x)
                                  | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
                              match x with
                                | Except.ok x => pure x
                                | Except.error x => pure x)
                        | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
                    | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
                | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e))
          match x with
            | Except.ok x => do
              let x ‚Üê
                ExceptT.run
                    (match x with
                    | Except.ok x => pure x
                    | Except.error x => pure x)
              match x with
                | Except.ok x => pure (Except.ok none)
                | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
            | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
        | Except.error e => pure (Except.error e)
    match x with
      | Except.ok x => pure x
      | Except.error x => pure x) =
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM (head‚úù :: tail‚úù) fun x => do
        let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
        if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    forM xss fun xs =>
        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)
 
m: Type ‚Üí Type
Œ±: Type
inst‚úù¬π: Monad m
p: Œ± ‚Üí m Bool
xss: List (List Œ±)
ih: (do
    let x ‚Üê
      ExceptT.run do
          do
            let x ‚Üê
              ExceptT.run
                  (forM xss fun x => do
                    let x ‚Üê
                      ExceptT.run do
                          let x ‚Üê
                            ExceptT.run
                                (forM x fun x => do
                                  let x ‚Üê
                                    ExceptT.run do
                                        let x_1 ‚Üê
                                          ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (p x)))))
                                        if x_1 = true then
                                            ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (throw (some x)))))
                                          else
                                            ExceptT.lift
                                              (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (pure ())))))
                                  match x with
                                    | Except.ok x => pure x
                                    | Except.error e => pure e)
                          match x with
                            | Except.ok x => pure x
                            | Except.error e => pure e
                    match x with
                      | Except.ok x => pure x
                      | Except.error e => pure e)
            match x with
              | Except.ok x => pure x
              | Except.error e => pure e
          ExceptT.lift (pure none)
    match x with
      | Except.ok x => pure x
      | Except.error e => pure e) =
  ExceptCpsT.runCatch do
    forM xss fun xs =>
        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
    ExceptCpsT.lift (pure none)
cons.nil
(do
    let x ‚Üê
      ExceptT.run
          (ExceptT.run
            (ExceptT.run
              (ExceptT.run
                (forM [] fun x => do
                  let x_1 ‚Üê ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (p x))))

                    ExceptT.run
                        (if x_1 = true then ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (ExceptT.lift (throw (some x)))))

                    | Except.ok x => pure x
                    | Except.error x => pure x))))

                            | Except.ok x => pure x

      | Except.ok x => pure x
      | Except.error x => pure x) =

        forM xs fun x => do
          let b ‚Üê ExceptCpsT.lift (p x)
          if b = true then throw (some x) else ExceptCpsT.lift (pure ())
